alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:11PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Navajo County near Castle Butte through 245 PM MST... At 211 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Castle Butte, or 28 miles northeast of Winslow, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Castle Butte. This includes State Route 87 between mile markers 367 and 372. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
